characters: SOPHIA AND BRETT AT THE LIBRARY, (FLASHBACK)
WATARI HANDING THE PHONE TO L, (FLASHBACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A working class neighborhood in the heart of Far Rockaway Broken down stoops adorn each home while CAR ALARMS and SHOUTING can be heard in the distance as the hard SQUABBL LOCALS go about their morning routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUKE MURRAY, 21, lies in bed, dead to the world, even as late morning sun fights its way in. Suddenly his SIDEKICK vibrates to life. He slowly starts to stir as the sidekick works its way of the desk and CRASHES to the floor with a THUNK. That does the trick... Luke starts to come to. On the surface he appears good-looking, even handsome; but behin his intense, blue eyes one can see the residual grit of bygone pain. He sits up and blearily rubs away the sleep when he notic his alarm clock. Adrenaline hits him in waves. He leaps out of the sheets and slings on a pair of jeans, racing out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. pulling on a shirt as he goes but in his haste he missteps and tumbles forward, crashing downwards, coming stop on the landing below. He springs up and makes a b-line for the door when he sto dead in his tracks, remembering. He turns back around... INT. LUKE’S ROOM ++. and tears through his sock drawer until he finds what he’s looking for. It’s a small jewelry box. He quickly pockets it and takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. weaving through the HUSTLE and BUSTLE of the morning commute as... °

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +++ PEOPLE funnel onto the closing doors of the “A” train

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, hold that door... Luke races towards the subway car but the cynical New Yor don't lift a finger as the departure BELLS RING out and t doors slowly close... «+. but Luke quickly slings his bag forward, wedging the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey... : The CONDUCTOR leans out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Come on, help me out. I’m gonna be late for class. The conductor shakes his head... the doors jerk back and forth... trying to open as Luke pulls free his bag. He go to enter when suddenly the doors slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! The conductor grins as the train begins to pull away. LUKE (CONT’D) You gotta be kiddin’ me! Luke pounds on the window in disbelief, futilely racing a the train, making his way to the end of the platform when suddenly -- -- a WOMAN SCREAMS. Luke spins around and sees a THIEF ri the woman’s purse away. She’s thrown off balance and topp backwards, crashing onto the tracks below. Stunned COMMUTERS stand there frozen as an express train ROARS towards the woman -- its HORN BLARING. Panic fills the air as Luke reacts without thinking. He races over, jumps down and moves to pick the woman up as.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. The CONDUCTOR yanks hard on the emergency BRAKE -- th SCREECHING HOWL OF METAL ON METAL -- as SPARKS FLY and SM BILLOWS -- but the train is moving too fast --  3. -- Luke sees it BARRELING towards him. ONLOOKERS hold the breath, others turn away as -- -- Luke makes a split second decision. He pushes the woma into a foot-deep trough between the tracks, covering her his body as -- -- The SCREECHING TRAIN runs over them. The crowd looks o aghast as the train slowly comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: Luke looks up at the inch of clearance above his head, it the difference between life and death.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Holy shit... To the CROWD’S surprise, Luke rolls out from underneath t train with the woman. They all CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, haggard and dirtied, rushes toward a lecture hall w the doors swing open and STUDENTS file out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Damn... SOPHIA, a good-looking brunette, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It’s a long story. PROFESSOR SELBY, 50's, bookish, spots Luke.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: You out did: yourself today, Mr. Murray. Instead of just being late you missed class all together.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry professor but I was only late because --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: Don’t ruin an apology with an excuse. Get here on time. That shouldn’t be hard for someone as smart as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But professor I -- Professor Selby waves it off as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- just saved someone’s life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Sophia make their way along.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh my god that’s crazy. Thank god you’re alright.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It was no big deal. Honestly. She smiles, that’s what she loves about him.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I still think you should tell Professor Selby what happened.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nah, it’s not worth it... But listen, uh... He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: About tonight, I can’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I got called into work. Disappointment fills her face.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Luke...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you, I swear. We'll do something tomorrow night. But I want you to have this. He pulls out the small jewelry box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy anniversary. She opens it and finds a GOLDEN CLADDAGH RING.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It was my mother’s. She would have worn it until I met the girl I would marry. He slips the ring onto her finger. LUKE (CONT’D) We’re officially engaged to be engaged. She gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The organized chaos of the SOUTH STREET SEAPORT begins it daily grind. Forklifts whiz back and forth and truckers upload their cargo as a FOREMAN makes his way over to Luk

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Joe College... when you finish those orders I’m gonna need your help with the grouper. Luke nods as he packs huge MACKERELS into heavy crates of ice. It’s bone-numbing work but it pays well and he can d it at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke crashes onto the seat and leans against the window, eyeing the bright lights of the metropolis as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -.. they begin to fade away and the train makes its way t the darkness that is Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hustles down the platform stairs and makes his way..  EXT. ST. MICHAEL’S CEMETERY - CONT. ++. to an OLD GOTHIC CEMETERY, knowingly weaving through various. tombstones, before stopping in front of a grave. stares at it for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey Ma, I just wanted you to know that I gave it to her. She loved it. You should have seen her. (beat ) Well, I gotta get going. I love ya. Luke goes to take off when he notices some unsavory characters up ahead. Even in the evening twilight Luke ca make out the SPARK of their CRACK PIPES. He quickly bangs a hard right, trying to avoid them when something gives him pause... He stops, looks all around, surprised to find his heart racing... He shakes his head, dismissing his fear when... +--+ he notices a fallen oak tree. It has pulverized an ornate HEADSTONE, laying waste to its centuries old morta He moves in closer to get a better look when he sees an OMINOUS BLACK. BOOK amongst the rubble. He picks it up, wiping debris from its cover. INSERT COVER: “DEATH NOTE” He almost laughs at the title as he flips it open and rea “THE HUMAN WHOSE NAME IS WRITTEN IN THIS BOOK SHALL DIE.” Luke grins at the ridiculousness of it all. He goes to th it away but-there’s something about the book that gives h pause.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: Suddenly his sidekick RINGS. LUKE (CONT’D) (into sidekick) Hey, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: AS NECESSARY
dialogues.text: SARAH, 12, Luke's rebellious little sister, checks the fridge. .

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (into phone) Nothing. I’m just starving over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’s Dad?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s not home yet.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Alright, hang tight. I’11 be there in a sec. INT. LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN - LUKE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Luke hurriedly enters as Sarah bangs out a text.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, you feel like having a grilled cheese sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Only if you’re makin’ it. He throws down his stuff and gets busy at the stove.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Did you do your homework?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because I’m gonna do it in study hall. He shoots her a look. SARAH (CONT’D) What? Everyone in my class is so stupid. It’s a joke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and do it now anyway. Just then POLICE CAPTAIN JOHN MURRAY, an incisive, no- nonsense type, enters, weary from a long shift.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Hey guys. Sorry, I’m late.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey Pop. Hey, Daddy. He blearily flips through a stack of.mail as he joins Luk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, your LSAT score came in.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know they e-mailed it to me last week.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Last week? Why didn’t you say anything? Luke just shrugs as Capt. Murray opens the letter, expect the worse.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Excitement flushes through him as he bear hugs Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Take it easy? You sly son of a gun. Do you know what this means?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It's not a big deal. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You’re something else, you really are Luke. (to Sarah) Do you know what your brother just did?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, but I got a feeling you're gonna tell me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: He just scored in the ninety-eighth percentile on his LSAT. How about that?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’re such a dork, Luke. He playfully smacks her as he makes his way up the stairs INT. LUKE’S ROOM +--+. and flips on the tv all the while rummaging through bookbag. He notices the Death Note. He can’t help but pag through it, stopping on the LAWS OF THE DEATH NOTE PAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Rejoice and fear, your lives rest in my hands... Luke grins as he reads the rules when suddenly the newsca grabs his attention. ON TV: OFFICERS, guns drawn, stand poised behind their CRUISERS as a REPORTER files an update.

dialogues.speaker: . REPORTER
dialogues.text: We're live here on Commercial Avenue where Mark Tocher, a convicted sex offender, is believed to have taken an entire family hostage -- GUNSHOTS RING out from the besieged home.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god! The Reporter and CAMERA MAN rush for cover as the camera zooms in on the PERPETRATOR, BLASTING away from a second story window, all the while shielding himself behind a terrified YOUNG MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Scumbag... Luke looks at the Death Note, twirling his pen as the per name flashes on screen. On a whim, almost as a joke, Luke writes MARK TOCHER in t book before tossing it into a waste basket and moving to bathroom. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke splashes water on his face and... INT. LUKE’S ROOM ++. re-enters brushing his teeth. He glances at the newscast. The COPS can’t return fire and stand there helplessly. LUKE shakes his head and returns to the bathroom when...

dialogues.speaker: ON NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: The terrified FAMILY comes rushing out from the house.  10.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Uh... we’re not sure what’s going on... OFFICERS race to the hostages’ aid as the reporter hurrie over to the Young Mother.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me ma’am, can you tell us what happened?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: It was a miracle. The MOTHER is hysterical, fighting back tears as OFFICERS off the Reporter and whisk her away.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Well, uh, we’re not exactly sure what just happened but it looks like the hostages are okay... Again, Mark Tocher... TOCHER’s mug shot fills the screen as LUKE re-enters, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. known felon and sex offender... Luke glances over; it looks like more of the same. He shu off the tv and crashes into bed, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia glances at her watch as Luke hurriedly joins her.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry I’m late.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You know what I’m gonna do, Luke, I’m gonna buy you a watch.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I don’t need a watch. I use this. He shows her his sidekick.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: That’s the problem, you can’t set your cell phone ahead. She rips it from his hands and messes with the settings.  ll.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I set my watch ahead and now I’m never late.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (grins) That won't work for me.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I know.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Trust me. All you gotta do is set it seven minutes ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Why seven?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Because five doesn’t give you enough time and ten is too easy to figure out. That’s why seven is just right. It’s enough time to do what you gotta do but too much of a hassle to figure out... She grows frustrated with the sidekick and hands it back, leaving a message on the display. INSERT: :-)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Right, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Trust me. It works. He doesn’t buy it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eight forty-three (as if saying quickly) what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Eight thirty-six. She realizes he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: One o three.  12.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Twelve fifty-six.

dialogues.speaker: . SOPHIA LUKE
dialogues.text: Two eleven. Two o four.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA LUKE
dialogues.text: Five fifty-five. Five forty-eight. She grins. It’s-no use. He rattles off the answers almost as fast as she asks.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Well with normal people it works.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'll take your word for it. They share a smile as they make their way along when suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. Luke notices Tocher’s mug shot on the papers that ado newsstand.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That thing in Bay Ridge last night, I didn’t know the guy died.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was gonna kill that whole family. A train comes to a roaring stop on the track next to them SOPHIA (CONT’D) Luke, come on, let’s go. Luke can’t help but shoot one last look at the papers bef hopping onto the train. INT. CLASSROOM —- FORDHAM Professor Selby lectures as Luke surfs the web on his lap  13.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: Hierocles said, “Law and justice are not always the same. And when they aren’t, destroying the law may be the first step toward changing it...” Luke only half listens as he finds what he’s looking for, it’s an article on the Bay Ridge incident. INSERT TEXT: “... miracle heart attack... gunman struggle with heart disease...” Luke can’t help but read with morbid fascination. The sto is all over the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke throws down his bookbag and moves to his desk when.. notices the Death Note in the waste basket. He pulls it out, flips it open and looks at the name he w -- Mark Tocher. It has to be a coincidence. Luke thinks for a moment, flips through the DEATH NOTE, reverting back to the “Laws of the Death Note Page.”

dialogues.speaker: DEATH NOTE PAGE
dialogues.text: (The following text is seen on screen as Luke reads aloud

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rule - The Death Note will not take effect unless the writer has the person’s face in their mind when writing their name. Therefore, people sharing the same name will not be affected.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON LUKE
dialogues.text: Luke shakes his head but the truth is, something urges hi onwards. He turns on the television and flips to COURT TV

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: «+. authorities are in hot pursuit of Daniel Stone, who allegedly shot and killed three people in a downtown courthouse this morning, sparking a citywide manhunt...  14. INSERT FOOTAGE of a ROPED OFF CRIME SCENE as INVESTIGATOR move about BLOOD STAINED MARBLE.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++. again, Stone managed to grab a guard’s gun and shoot. his way past several deputies. Luke turns up the volume as a PICTURE of Stone fades up. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) We're gonna go live to the Belt Parkway where our news chopper is following the chase.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: Luke watches as the suspect’s vehicle dangerously weaves and out of traffic before losing control and smashing int several cars. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) Oh my god, this is terrible! The perp, Stone, jumps out and makes a run for it as the frantically give chase. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) The suspect simply refuses to give up... Stone races to a twenty foot overpass and to the cops’ amazement... jumps down, rolls to absorb the impact and r away with only a slight limp. The cops are forced to double back. NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) I can’t believe this... Luke looks on as he writes Daniel Stone in the Death Note He eyes him for a moment... then shakes his head at the improbability of it all.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: Stone draws his gun, car jacks a red Mustang and begins t race away when suddenly the Mustang swerves off the road SMASHES into a fire hydrant.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rule - If the cause of death is not specified, the person will simply die of a heart attack. A torrent of water rains down on the MUSTANG as LUKE rise his feet.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: It appears the suspect has come to a stop. Two blue and whites pull up and COPS race out, guns drawn

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again, Stone is armed and considered very dangerous. Hopefully he’ll do the right thing and surrender. The FLATFOOTS cautiously approach and rip Stone from the car... but his body is limp and lifeless. Luke shoots a look over to the book.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No way... Just then the doorbell RINGS, startling him. INT. / EXT. LIVING ROOM - CONT. Luke moves to the door and is taken aback when he sees a POLICE OFFICER standing outside. He slowly opens the door

dialogues.speaker: POLICE. OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hello, are you Luke Murray? Luke tightens up as he nods.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend called and told us you were the hero from the “A” train. We've been looking for you. You ran off before anyone could get your name.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Oh... Yeah, don’t worry about it. It’s no big deal.  16.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, you did a great thing kid. The mayor wants to give you a medal.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have to do that. Honestly. Luke goes to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hey, listen kid, the mayor needs all the good press he can get. He’s not gonna pass up a photo op like this. So shine your shoes and get a hair cut ‘cause you’re gonna be in the paper. INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke reenters, his mind churning, as the TV plays in the background.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Authorities have just announced that the suspect, Daniel Stone is dead. Luke’s hairs go on end.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're not exactly sure what happened but the police emphasize he wasn’t shot. Luke looks over to the Death Note as a sick feeling comes over him. INT. LUKE’S ROOM - LATER Luke browses through the DAILY NEWS, reading about the St incident. The headline reads: “LIGHTNING STRIKES TWICE!” INSERT TEXT: ”... second criminal in two days dies of a h attack...”

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (entering) Hey, can I get a couple bucks for lunch tomorrow? Luke turns to her.  17.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you alright? He shakes his head “no” as he gets up, rushes over to the bathroom and pukes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Sophia walk along.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Hey, everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sorry. I just needed to get some air. He solemnly looks out at the Hudson for a long beat as hi mind begins to churn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray makes Sarah dinner as Luke enters. He pauses moment before he approaches his father.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Dad, I wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Sure, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I wanna see mom's case file. Capt. Murray’s demeanor deadens.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Sarah, do me a favor and go to your room. She just looks at him. CAPT. MURRAY (CONT’D) I'm not asking. Go. He waits for her to leave.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s this all about?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I just want to see it.  18.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Dad, please, I’m an adult. I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Luke, nothing good will come from it. I’m sorry but my answer's no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke takes a breath before approaching the GUARD manning cage.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey kid. What’s goin’ on?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Same old, same old. Luke moves towards the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You doin’ some work for the old man?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Funny, he didn’t mention anything to me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (lying) Oh, he probably just forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke combs through two banker boxes, reading through vari reports and interviews. INSERT TEXT: ...armed robbery... escalated to felony murder... female victim, LINDA MURRAY, pronounced dead at scene... .44 caliber weapon used... Luke grows more and more angry as he goes through the _ Materials. He finds a tape labeled “security footage.” He stops, thinks for a moment before decidingly putting t tape into a VCR, bracing himself.  19. ON SCREEN: Grainy, fast-motion video of -- -- A MASKED GUNMAN barging into a Korean grocery store an sticking a gun in the CASHIER’S face. The cashier cowers back as the gunman rips open the regis and empties it when -- -- the cashier notices MRS. MURRAY as she tries to hide a YOUNG LUKE behind an aisle. The gunman catches his eye-line, turns to Mrs. Murray and yells at her. The Cashier tries to take advantage, reaching for a gun u the counter but the gunman is too quick -- -- he turns back -- blows away the Cashier and empties hi gun on Mrs. Murray as he races away. Young Luke rushes to his dying mother’s side. Horror fill his face as he cries out for help.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON LUKE
dialogues.text: The pain of that day fills his face. He SNAPS off the TV rips a picture off a file folder. The post-it on it reads “Possible Suspect, ALEJANDRO LOZANO”

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Capt. Murray takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it Luke, I told you not to come down here.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me about this guy, Lozano? Capt. Murray sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: There was no reason to...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Do you think he did it?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I can’t say for sure.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: There must be something we can do.  20.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I did everything humanly possible, Luke, I cashed in very favor, worked every angle. There is. nothing we can do. Believe me... Short of a confession there’s no way we're ever gonna get the guy that did it. It was just too random of a crime. Luke eyes his father for a long moment. CAPT. MURRAY (CONT’D) Come on, pack that stuff up and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke crashes onto a bench and sighs deeply when suddenly several cruisers come to a SCREECHING halt. COPS rush out, hurriedly leading a startled TEENAGE ASIAN GIRL inside. A sense of urgency fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters as the girl is led into a room. He notices bl spatter on her cheek as she begins to shake. More PATROL MEN bristle about as Luke moves to his father side, where he’s being debriefed by DT. GOEMMANS (Caucasi and Dt. WASHINGTON (African American).

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: It was a home invasion. She was the only one to get out.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: And the rest of the family?

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: All dead... Patrol is there now... These guys butchered them, Capt. Luke looks at the girl as MEDICS tend to her -- he knows pain that awaits her.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Any, suspects?  21.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: Yeah, she just made a positive ID. Vice has been looking for these guys, their names are Tibbs and Rodriguez. Dt. Goemmans hands Capt. Murray a flyer with the suspects names and pictures. He looks at it for a long moment befo moving to the girl's room.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: Luke watches his father try and console the girl as he pi up a copy of the flier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke walks down the steps when suddenly OFFICERS race pas him, their radios crackling.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (FROM RADIO)
dialogues.text: +++. again, suspects Tibbs and Rodriguez have been spotted at ninety-eighth and Broadway. Officers are in pursuit... Luke is taken aback as the OFFICERS race to their cruiser and take off. Luke thinks for a moment before he jumps on his moped and chases after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nimbly ZIPS in and out of traffic, blowing past cars trying to keep up as the BLUE AND WHITES rip through the city, SIRENS BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cruiser rounds a corner, Luke tailing it, when the DRIV a YOUNG OFFICER, spots Tibbs and Rodriguez (wielding .45’ weaving their way through a CROWD. The Young Officer tries to cut the perps off, coming at t head-on with his cruiser... but the perps spot him. LEAD fills the air as they OPEN FIRE on the cruiser. PEOPLE SCREAM and RUSH for cover. A WOMAN falls to the ground, SHRIEKING in pain as a ROUND rips through her leg while ANOTHER CIVILIAN takes two to the chest and crashes down in a heap. The gunmen charge forward, FIRING away. Only the Young Officer stands in their way.  22. He tries to return fire behind the riddled cruiser but he badly out gunned. Luke realizes that if he doesn’t act fa the officer is done for. He hurriedly takes out the Death Note and writes the perp names as SHARDS OF GLASS and SHRAPNEL rain down on the Yo Officer. He’s as good as dead, when suddenly... ++. one of the perps topples over, falling like a tree. Seconds later the other perp suffers the same fate. Just like that. the scene goes dead almost as fast as it erupted. Several officers race over to the fallen perps, guns poised... only to discover the perps are dead and ha no wounds. The Young Officer rises up and looks at them. Something h just happened but no one knows what. INT. LUKE’S ROOM - LATER Luke enters and tries to collect himself but he struggles keep his emotions at bay. He moves to his desk and sweeps everything off of it, let it all out, papers flying everywhere. A newspaper lands at his feet. He notices the picture of WANTED FUGITIVE draped across the cover and kicks the dai rag across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray makes his way over to the CORONER.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What’s up Doc?

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: I thought you should see this... He slaps a couple of X-RAYS onto a LIGHT BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We pulled them from the two shooters, Tibbs and Rodriguez. (pointing) Look at the curvature of the arteries... they're completely unblocked.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: So? These guys collapsed mid- stride, clutching their chests. You'd expect to find all kinds of plaque stopping up their airways.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What are you saying Doc?

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: I’m saying this might be one for the medical books. It’s like their hearts froze and collapsed in on themselves. (beat) I’ve never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Are you saying it’s suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: (pause) I’m saying it’s not natural... Just thought you should know. Capt. Murray nods and takes off, pushing through double d where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -.. Dt. Goemmans and Washington watch a newscast about th mysterious nature of Tibbs and Rodriguez’s deaths; it’s c the story is capturing the public’s fascination.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: All right, come on fellas, let’s get out of here. INT. LUKE’S ROOM - NIGHT Luke sits at his desk and flips through pictures of his M when Sophia moves up behind him and gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, when did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Just now. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nothing. He hurriedly tucks the pictures away.  24.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I got you a new shirt for tomorrow. He puts on his best face as she presses a bright orange s against him.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sophia, are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It’s orange.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's not orange, it’s salmon. I think it makes you look handsome. Luke shakes his head incredulously. SOPHIA (CONT’D) Try it on... Come on. For me. He makes his way towards the bathroom. She sneaks a peak his desk, spotting the photos of his mom and can’t help b feel awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor holds court before a bevy of reporters as Luke, wearing the orange shirt, stands stoically at his side.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Luke, I’ve known your father for.a long time, he’s one of New York’s finest. So while it gives me. great pleasure to award you with this citation of virtue, I must say I’m not surprised. Capt. Murray, Sarah, and Sophia look on proudly as the Ma hands Luke a medal. MAYOR (CONT’D) On behalf of a grateful city, I thank you for your heroism. Your unselfishness and bravery is an example to all New Yorkers. PHOTOGRAPHERS SNAP away.  25. EXT. ST. MICHAEL'S CEMETERY — EVENING Luke solemnly makes his way to his mother’s headstone.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, mom. It’s me... I wanted to come by and tell you that I’m gonna do something I feel I have to do. I’m not sure how you’ll feel about it. Please don’t think less of me. I love you. Luke kisses his fingers and brings them to the headstone before placing the medal of virtue on top. INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke hacks into the NYPD intranet where he uses a felon locator database to find Alejandro Lozano’s name and pict He eyes his long arrest record and notes that Lozano is currently incarcerated at Rahway State Prison. Luke also takes note of Lozano’s two known accomplices, t GURTSKY BROTHERS, BRETT, a petty thief with a long histor misdemeanors and RICK, a sex offender with a rap sheet a long. He quickly jots down their last known address and phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke eyes the Gurtsky brothers through the window of thei apartment. He takes a deep breath and steadies his resolv before dialing a nearby pay phone. INT. APARTMENT - TENEMENT BUILDING - CONT. Brett picks up the phone as Rick lazily watches TV.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Let me speak to Rick.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m the guy behind the mysterious deaths.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And I’m the Tooth Fairy. Brett hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Who the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Some asshole. Luke quickly re-dials as he grabs hold of the Death Note.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Listen to me, we can do this the easy way or the hard way. Put Rick on.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Drop dead, scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m warning you, don’t make me do something I’m gonna regret.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (overhearing) Gimmie the phone. Brett hands it to him. RICK (CONT’D) You got something to say to me, tough guy?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, do as I say and I'1l let you live. Otherwise I’m gonna make you pay for the lives you destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  27. Rick SLAMS the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: What’d he say?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Nothing. EXT. PAY PHONE - CONT. A flurry of emotions flash through Luke... He looks down the Death Note as his hand shakes but something urges him onwards. INT. APARTMENT — INTERCUT Brett moves to the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Gimmie a beer. Brett grabs a cold one and tosses it to Rick but the beer sails right past him as Rick clutches his chest.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Hey stop dicking around... Rick crashes onto the floor face first, convulsing wildly Brett’s face begins to deaden. He rushes over and kneels down next to him. BRETT (CONT’D) What the f...? Brett goes to dial 911 when the PHONE RINGS. He almost JU out of his skin as he answers. BRETT (CONT’D) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Do you believe me now?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: He’s dead Brett and there’s nothing you can do about it. Brett slowly realizes it’s true. He can’t find a pulse as his brother lies there motionless.  28.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen Brett, I’m gonna ask you some questions. If you tell me the truth, I might let you live. Brett begins to shake. LUKE (CONT’D) You used to run with Alejandro Lozano. Right?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Did he ever rob a Korean grocery store in Queens?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Think. Think real hard, Brett. Or it will be the last thing you do. (pause) Look at your brother. I know you don’t want to end up like him. Brett trembles as he looks over at Rick’s corpse.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: I swear to you, I don’t know. Lozano did a lot of licks without me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Don’t mess with me, Brett.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: I’m not, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Okay. Did Lozano ever own a .44 caliber pistol?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Yeah. He had an Ansley.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Did he have it back in ninety- seven?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: He's had it for as long as I've known him.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What’d he do with it?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I’m pretty sure his girl sold it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: A pawn shop in Yonkers.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You know the name of the place?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Come on Brett, you gotta do better than that.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: I swear that’s all I know!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Alright. What’s his girl’s name?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Elsa... Elsa Florip.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Okay, you did good, Brett. I know you’re not like your brother so I’m gonna let you live. But you gotta promise me you’ll stay out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: I promise... on my mother’s soul.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Good because if you don’t and you tell someone about our little conversation I’m gonna come looking for you... and we both know what that means.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hangs up the phone and leans up against a wall, chal full of emotion as he looks down at the Death Note. He ta a quick moment to try and collect himself before taking o INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke enters, breathing heavily. He can’t believe he actua did it. He looks at the book once more as... INT. CORONER’S OFFICE - DAY ++. Capt. Murray, Dt. Goemmans and Dt. Washington eye Ric Gurtsky’s body.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: (joining them) Same as the last two. His heart just imploded. And get this. I looked to see if anyone else had come across something like this... I got two hits. Both were recent. Both were here in New York. He shows them a file of TOCHER, the home invasion gunman, STONE, the courthouse shooter.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What's going on, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: (pause) What about his brother, did he see anything?

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: No, nothing. Said they were just watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Well, ain’t karma a bitch. They can’t help but grin.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: I wish it was that simple...

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Any chance this is all some kind of strange happenstance?  31.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: Medically speaking, no. (pause) Something is triggering these attacks. I’m talking massive, complete heart failure on the drop of a dime.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Could they have been poisoned?

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: I’ve run their samples through every test known to man. ‘Twice. Not one hit. Nothing. He hands them copies of his report. CORONER (CONT’D) I thought it might've been some kind of virus, like that amoeba that killed those people out in Lake Havasu. But I didn’t find any signs of infection during the autopsies. (beat) The long and short of it is they all died of heart attacks that physiologically none of them should have had... I can’t keep calling it a coincidence. Gonna officially change the cause of death to undetermined.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Alright then, Doc. Looks like we have an investigation then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray and his men move to an unmarked car.

dialogues.speaker: DI. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Whaddaya want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be some logical explanation. Cross reference the victims’ criminal histories. See where they did time and if there was any overlap. Most prisons are a walking staph infection. Maybe there is some kind of connection there.  32.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: You got it Cap.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Goemmans, when you get a chance head over to the Med school at NYU. Talk to some toxicologists, see if there’s a way to beat Doc’s tests. Goemmans nods as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Luke flips through a phone book, settling in on a lis of pawn shops. He rips out the page and cross references with a print out from YAHOO YELLOW PAGES, making sure no store slips through the cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia studies on a couch as Luke enters.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You ready to roll?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Luke can’t help but eye the newspaper on a nearby table, headline reads, “Good Guys 5, Bad Guys 0, More Mysterious Deaths.”

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (noticing) It’s crazy, those guys dying like that.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah... She senses something.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You gotta promise me you won’t say anything.  33.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke leads Sophia to the back of the room as they take a in front of a computer.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Check this out. Luke hacks into the NYPD remote access server.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I have my dad’s username and password. Sophia tenses up but looks on, intrigued, as Luke pulls u the 2008 MURDER BOOK (a catalogue of all the murders that year).

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I looked these guys up, just out of curiosity. And you know what? They were all career criminals.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: So maybe what happened to them isn’t such a bad thing... She just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just log off already, you're making me nervous. She hurriedly clicks shut the window as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. Capt. Murray, Goemmans and Washington walk along.  34.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: So there’s no nexus that links the victims, no common criminal affiliation or associates?

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: No, we didn’t find anything, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: So whaddaya think?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Honestly? Not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray, Goemmans and Washington approach the COMMISSIONER.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You wanted to see us?

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: Yeah, L called. Capt. Murray is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: Who’s L?

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: He’s a profiler with the FBI’s special crimes unit. Real clandestine bunch.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: He’s been following these mysterious deaths in the news and wants to do a little poking around. That gives Capt. Murray pause. COMMISSIONER (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: I know he’s a cowboy but he’s the best there is. Come on, his man is waiting for us.  35. INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - CONT. Capt. Murray, Goemmans, Washington and the Commissioner e and find an austere old JAPANESE MAN/WATARI waiting for t

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: Watari, it’s good to see you again. This is Capt. Murray, Dt. Goemmans and Dt. Washington. Greetings are exchanged. COMMISSIONER (CONT’D) Watari is gonna put us in touch with L. (to Watari) We’re ready when you are. “rn Watari opens up a laptop and a large L fades up on its screen as a filtered VOICE emanates out:

dialogues.speaker: L, (FROM LAPTOP)
dialogues.text: I apologize for the cloak and dagger routine but as you know I prefer to remain anonymous. Goemmans looks on curiously.

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I believe these mysterious deaths are, more likely than not, targeted attacks.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: The probability that the victims would all be male cons, whose hearts imploded in the middle of committing felonies, is statistically impossible. (beat) Unless the CIA is up to something we're not aware of, my guess would be that these cons are being specifically targeted.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISSIONER
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I don’t know.  36.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: With all due respect L, I agree with some of what you’re saying. But the truth is we don’t have a single piece of physical evidence that supports your theory.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Yes we do. The dead bodies. A formula fades up on the laptop screen. It reads: Actus Reus + Mens Rea + The Result = Murder.

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As we all know, these are the elements of murder. Now if you work backwards you can see that we have the result. All of the victims are dead. We also know the mens rea;. these deaths are no coincidence. We've statistically proven that. So the only piece of the puzzle we’re missing is the actus reus. We don’t know how they’re doing it.... But I assure you, it’s only a matter of time before another con turns up dead. The men all consider this as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. Luke talks on a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m trying to track down a -44 Caliber Ansley that might have come through your place. Can you check your chain of possession records for me? (listens to response) Yeah, I'll hold. Luke flips through his list when he gets a text. INSERT SCREEN: From Sophia: Luke, where you at? We gotta get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Selby lectures as Luke and Sophia enter and mak their way to the back.  37.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: This is from the Daily News, “Divine Justice Strikes the Big Apple” He picks up a another paper.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Post headline reads: “Only the good die young? Not anymore... More Mysterious Deaths.” (beat) Do you think these types of headlines could affect peoples’ behavior? He scans the classroom before picking up a copy of the Ne York Times. Luke sits PROFESSOR SELBY (CONT’D) “Over the past two weeks police precincts around the city reported a slight drop in violent crimes.” Now, this might be a statistical anomaly... It might have nothing to do with these deaths, who knows... But one way or the other these stories have captured the zeitgeist’s attention. up in attention. PROFESSOR SELBY (CONT’D) Granted, the terms we're dealing with here are pretty harsh. It’s life and death. That always grabs people’s attention. But you have to admit, this type of conduct regulating behavior can be very effective. Do you think the fact that some criminals have died has deterred others from acting? (pause) What if I told you that I would execute anyone I caught surfing the web during class? After I shot one or two of you, wouldn’t the rest of you close down your browsers? This gets some CHUCKLES from the class as Luke looks on intently.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students funnel out as Luke makes his way over to Profess Selby.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Professor, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: Sure, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You said once that sometimes the law and justice aren’t one and the same... That sometimes you have to destroy the law in order to get justice.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: Well, that’s not exactly the quote I referenced but yeah, that’s kinda the gist of it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Well, how do you know? How do you know that time has come?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR SELBY
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that’s just something you have to decide for yourself. Luke considers this. INT. LUKE’S HOUSE - LATER Capt. Murray pours himself a stiff drink as Luke enters.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Isn't it a little early for happy hour, Dad? (beat) What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You remember that Asian girl we brought in the other day? The one whose parents were killed.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Found out today she doesn’t have any other family here. They’re gonna place her in foster care.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That sucks. They share a moment, both knowing what lies ahead for her INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke enters, mind churning, emotion brewing. He pulls out the Death Note and stares at it for a long hard moment.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I can do more... I can be something they fear.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: He grabs his laptop and takes off as a keen sense of reso builds and builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke researches criminals on his laptop, looking for the worst of the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke walks, laptop in hand, searching for wi-fi signals w he notices a STUDENT passed out on a couch, a MANGA spraw across his chest. The germ of an idea forms in Luke’s mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EDITORIAL STAFF huddles around a computer, eyeing a suspicious e-mail as Capt. Murray, Dt. Goemmans and Dt. Washington join them.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: It came in this morning. Capt. Murray reads a printout of the e-mail aloud. INSERT TEXT: “Let it be known that I am responsible for these mysterious deaths.  40. I am acting to improve the lot of others by striking out against the tyranny of man, sending forth a ripple of hope that will sweep down the mightiest walls of injustice and set fear in the hearts of evil men."

dialogues.speaker: KIRA
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray scans through the post script and notices several names listed below.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He says he’s gonna kill five more criminals to prove he’s for real. (pause) Whaddya want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Don’t do anything. But do mea favor, set this computer aside until you hear from me. The Editor nods as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. Capt. Murray exits, followed by Goemans and Washingto

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Whaddaya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. This world has gotten so twisted, crooked looks straight and straight looks crooked. He eyes the list of criminals in the e-mail.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we should keep an eye on this all-star list. (to Goemmans) Contact Luis Patterson’s attorney. Let him know a threat has been made against his client.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Washington, I want you to contact our sex crime unit, see if there is any news regarding Clarence Smith.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: The high heel rapist? He’s still at large. Nobody knows where he is.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I know, do the best you can. I/’11 try and track down Sanchez and the other guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke eyes a live newscast as a steely resolve fills his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROWD of REPORTERS break into a frenzy as LUIS PATTERSO exits the courthouse, surrounded by a team of LAWYERS.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1
dialogues.text: The defendant, Louis Patterson, heir to the Patterson fortune, admitted raping and killing the victim during a closed court session. However, admissions made during plea negotiations are inadmissible. A grief stricken MOTHER, surrounded by her family, cries with heartache.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1
dialogues.text: The jury never heard Patterson's confession, which is what many believe led to today’s hung jury. INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke writes in the DEATH NOTE as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... REPORTERS pepper Patterson with questions.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2 REPORTER 3
dialogues.text: How do you explain your What about the DNA evidence confession? that links you to the crime?  42.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen the evidence you’re referring to was inadmissable. Now please -- Patterson and his lawyers push past the reporters when...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You bastard! You killed my daughter!!! Patterson almost goads with insolence -- he thinks he’s gotten away with murder when... ++. he’s crippled by a massive heart attack -- air escape him as he keels over and tumbles down the courthouse step -- breaking his neck as his head THUMPS against the pavem INT. LUKE’S ROOM - DIFFERENT DAY Luke scrolls through the FBI’s Ten Most Wanted List. He e a picture of MARC SANCHEZ. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez races along, chased by two COPS, his sweaty face intermittently revealed as... «++. he sprints under shafts of light cast down by the st lamps.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Stop right there! But Sanchez keeps hauling ass and rips around a bend. INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke begins to write in the Death Note as... EXT. STREET - CONT. ++. a winded Sanchez grabs a WOMAN from behind and brings gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Ah! No, please! The cops stop in their tracks as Sanchez spins the woman around, shielding himself.  43.

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: (gun drawn) Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Fuck you, pig! Sanchez grins as he drags the woman towards a car when suddenly a heart attack shoots through him. He keels over pain and dies.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Luke’s pen as it glides across the Death Note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray covers his face with a handkerchief as he st down at the bloated dead body of CLARENCE SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
dialogues.text: The neighbors complained about the smell. That’s when patrol found him. Capt. Murray and his team kneel down to get a better look

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: We should give this Kira guy a medal. Dt. Washington grins.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I need to know the time of death.

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
dialogues.text: Well, by the look of this rigamortis it’s been a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Goemmans, hang here until we have an official TOD. Cross reference it with the time stamp from the e- mail that was sent to the Times. I want to know whether Smith was dead before or after that e-mail was sent. And Washington, I want to know the cause of death ASAP. They nod as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+» Luke exits and crosses off yet another pawn shop from list before stopping in front of a newsstand, reading the headlines. - More Mysterious Deaths - 4 of FBI’S 10 Most Wanted Found Dead - Cardiac Arrest The Culprit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters and sits at a computer as a heightened energy fills the room and TEENS bristle about.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN
dialogues.text: (to his friends) Hey, check out this Youtube clip. The teens watch the footage of Patterson tumbling down th courthouse steps.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 2
dialogues.text: Yeah! F’ that dude! They all laugh when a newscast, playing on a plasma in th b.g., grabs their attention.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: While the police and the scientific community continue to search for an explanation there’s growing chatter that a mysterious figure, simply known as Kira, is responsible for these mysterious deaths. Luke watches the kids eye the newscast intently.

dialogues.speaker: NEW ANCHOR
dialogues.text: A declaration was allegedly e- mailed to the New York Times earlier this week. In it Kira claimed he was striking down criminals in order to protect the innocent. A chorus of HOOTS and HOLLERS rain down from the teens.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: The Times will neither confirm nor deny the story while authorities refuse to comment. So the question is... Is Kira for real or a made up Bogeyman?  45. A grin crosses Luke’s face as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “pr” ++. the L logo fills.a laptop screen and the investigative team debriefs him.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: The COD for Clarence Smith was cardiac arrest. We're still trying to pin down an exact time of death but it’s clear he died after the e- mail was sent to the Times. Same goes for Luis Patterson and Marc Sanchez.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Have you been able to track down the e-mail’s IP address?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it came from a hacked computer in the Bronx. My detectives interviewed the owner but he wasn’t much help.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Check with NSA. See if they can trace the hack.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: We already did. Their guys are working on it. So what do you make of this Kira stuff?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I think it’s our perp’s way of reaching out to us.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: He wants us to understand what he’s doing. Look at the name he chose. Kira. In Eastern cultures Kira is like the four horsemen of the apocalypse. They say that when the world becomes unlivable Kira will swoop down, wash away the filth and renew the earth. That’s how our guy views himself. He’s trying to right the world. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s exactly the type of mind-set I would expect from a single vindictive perpetrator, which is what I think we’re dealing. with.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: L, there’s no way one guy is doing all of this.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I disagree Captain Murray and I’11 show you why. A graph fades up on the laptop. L (CONT'D) . This graph plots the number of perpetrators involved in a crime against the corresponding success rate. As you can see the more people involved, the less likely they are to succeed. If we assume that this is a conspiracy, it would require several accomplices across the country. Everyone studies the graph.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: And with several accomplices, the success rate drops drastically.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Exactly. And previous experience tells us that with a conspiracy like this, someone would have come forward with something by now.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I don’t buy it. You’re manipulating your statistics to read the way you want them to read. How can someone kill a guy on the FBI’s most wanted list in California and then three hours later kill somebody else in Jersey? .It doesn’t make any sense. How do you reconcile that with your theory?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I can’t right now. But what I can do is narrow down our search and hopefully smoke out our killer.  47.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: You’ll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ATTENDANT flips through his files as Luke looks on beh a bulletproof window.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You said you were looking for a .44 Ansley?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. The attendant continues to flip through his files.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not even sure if it came through here... just trying to track it down.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (stops, eyes a record) Bingo... .44 caliber Ansley. Came in nineteen ninety-eight. A flash of excitement shoots through Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Can you tell me who pawned it?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: I can but it will cost ya.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Everything in life has its price, kid.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks?  48.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: A hundred.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Alright... but only if it was hawked by Elsa Florip, otherwise you can stick it up your ass. The attendant grins as he SLAMS the record against the window. The signature reads: Elsa Florip.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Pay up. Luke goes to hand over the money but stops short.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (checks the record) Looks like I sold it to the Jersey city Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Jersey City Police...?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (remembering) Yeah, they were doing one of those buy back things. I couldn’t move a bunch of old pieces so I hawked it to them. Luke looks on in disbelief as he hands over the money. EXT.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Luke dials up a pay phone. INT.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hi, can I have the crime stoppers hotline, I’d like to make an anonymous tip... LUKE’S ROOM - EVENING Sarah plays Wii as Luke hurriedly enters.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, I need the tv.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm in the middle of a game here.  49.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It’s important. He pulls away the controller. LUKE (CONT’D) (hitting a button) There, it’s paused. Sarah lets out a sigh as Luke switches the tv input and f what he’s looking for.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS 4 ANCHOR
dialogues.text: We’re about to go live to the FBI’s New York field office... INT. FBI FIELD OFFICE - PODIUM ~— SAME TIME A sharp-looking white MALE stands at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS 4 ANCHOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ++. where they have an update regarding the recent string of mysterious deaths. BACK ON Luke and Sarah as they both eye the TV.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Luke, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (pause) If you were Kira, would you kill the guy that killed mom?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, we don’t talk about that. He quickly snaps off the Wii.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Go finish your homework. An exasperated look crosses Sarah’s face... but she reali she crossed a line.  50.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Luke. He doesn’t respond as she solemnly exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray and a couple of New York’s finest watch the newscast.

dialogues.speaker: SHARP LOOKING WHITE MALE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Good evening...

dialogues.speaker: SHARP LOOKING WHITE MALE
dialogues.text: +-. My name is Lind L. Taylor, more commonly know as L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Murray and the others are all taken aback, L is revealing his identity.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: He’s younger than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: L/SHARP LOOKING WHITE MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m a profiler with the FBI's special crimes unit.

dialogues.speaker: L/SHARP LOOKING WHITE MALE
dialogues.text: I’ve been asked to help track down the serial killer who calls himself Kira. : INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke sits up in attention.

dialogues.speaker: L, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: This crime spree must come to an end.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Crime spree?  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia watches the newscast as STUDENTS gather round.

dialogues.speaker: L, (ON JUMBO TRON)
dialogues.text: Only someone with a God complex would be arrogant enough to commit such audacious crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOM, LUKE’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But let me tell you something Kira, you’re not God; you're a vile, self- righteous, hypocrite. Luke begins to grow angry as he grabs hold of the Death N

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are far lower than the criminals you think you have the right to kill. The book intensifies Luke’s anger as he holds it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What would you know about it? Before Luke realizes it something changes,_he looks like someone else. It’s his eyes. They narrow and harden as a .Murderous qlaze comes over him.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Kira, you’re nothing more than a murderer, too afraid to show your own face. Luke begins to write Lind L. Taylor in the Death Note. L (CONT’D) We will hunt you down and use every means necessary to bring you to justice. Just as he finishes the last pen stroke he snaps out of i

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What the f...? He can’t believe what he’s just done. He looks at the Dea Note. It’s definitely affecting him.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: No one has the right to take the law into their own hands.  52. He quickly scribbles out the name and turns to the tv wit bated breath...

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s only a matter of -- Uhhh! L clutches his chest, GASPING for air as he is struck by massive heart attack. SOPHIA and the STUDENTS react with shock and horror. THREE FBI TYPES rush to L's aid as he slumps over in his chair. Capt. MURRAY and the OFFICERS are taken aback but no one so than LUKE.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Luke watches the FBI agents drag a lifeless L off screen.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT
dialogues.text: Call 911! We need an ambulance! Unnerved, Luke takes a step back and eyes the Death Note the tv screen goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consternation runs rampant.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: What the hell just happened?!

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (to Washington) Call your buddy at the bureau and find out.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: (re: L) Is he dead? The truth is no one knows when just then Watari enters. WATARI ° I need everyone to gather ‘round Watari directs their attention to a large screen in the center of the room. “rn Suddenly the L logo flashes up on screen and we hear the same filtered voice from before:  53.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: The man you saw on tv is dead... He was a death row inmate who agreed to pose as me in hopes of reducing his sentence. Capt. Murray and his men shake their heads, not knowing w to think.

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His sacrifice, while incredibly tragic, was also incredibly valuable... Now we know Kira is here in New York.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: We made it look like a national broadcast but it was restricted to the five boroughs. Capt. Murray grows more and more angry.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What is going on L? How the hell did he just kill that guy?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Well you know something, goddamn it! How’d you know he’d come after you?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I didn’t. But it fits the profile. Our guy is impulsive, brash. It makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. This freakin’ guy just sent a heart attack through the air and you’re sitting here making deductions.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: All I can do is work the evidence I’m given. Every investigation is a progression, you know that Captain Murray. Different details come into focus at different times.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You got some balls, L! You can’t just send someone to their death like that!

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I had no choice. Kira will not stop. He’s going to keep on killing. But for the first time we're starting to close in on him. The faster we act the more lives we can save.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What the hell are we up against?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: God only knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capt. Murray and his team exit the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: Thank God we have L. Capt. Murray shoots him a look. INT. LUKE’

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? You gotta give L some credit. He just smoked out a shadow.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: What he just did makes him no different than Kira.

dialogues.speaker: S LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Luke, down and out, sits with Sophia, watching the news a various COMMENTATORS RANT about Kira.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I don’t get it, how the hell’s he doing it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but Kira slipped up, he shouldn’t have killed that guy. Luke shuts off the tv.  55.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Why’d you do that?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'm spent, can we call it a night?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Sure. INT. LUKE’S ROOM - NIGHT Luke sleeps next to Sophia when he begins to toss and tur Suddenly he wakes up, breathing heavily. Something has hi rattled. He gets up and moves to the mirror. He’s surprised to see bags under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Go back to sleep. He turns to the Death Note, eyeing it uneasily, honing in a distinct Japanese character/word engraved on its bindin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke approaches TOSH (Japanese, 50’s) as he preps for wor

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Tosh, can I ask you something. What’s this mean? He hands him a piece of paper with the Japanese character/word written on it. Tosh looks at it, pulls out his lighter and sets the paper ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: That is a word we never speak. Even saying it brings bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Tosh, come on man, give me a break. What’s it mean?

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: (reluctant) It’s an ancient word, it means Shinigami.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Shin -- what? Tosh won't say it again as he leaves Luke standing there. INT. LUKE’S ROOM Luke makes several queries on a reference portal, trying various spellings of “Shinigami” but to no avail when. he hears the door downstairs. INT. LUKE’S LIVING ROOM Capt. Murray enters as Sarah watches TV.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey daddy, a detective from Jersey City called. He said it was important. She gestures towards a post-it near the phone as Luke mak his way to the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Luke discreetly looks on as Capt. Murray dials.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT, MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hi, this is Captain Sean Murray. I’m returning your call. (waits for response) You're kidding me... a -44 Caliber Ansley, huh... Capt. Murray makes his way down the hall to get some priv INT. HALLWAY - CONT.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Sure, I could pull the slugs from my wife’s case. I’11l have them rushed over. I really appreciate the heads up.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What was that about?  57. Capt. Murray turns surprised to find Luke standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was it about mom?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: (pause) They still gotta check the ballistics but they think they might have found the murder weapon. Luke is pleased as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a“ ” . ++. the L logo fades up on a laptop screen and Watari Goemmans, Washington and Capt. Murray enter.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: I’ve reexamined the time of death for each Kira killing. A string of data races across a large projection screen behind L’s laptop. L (CONT’D) Each out of state death has been converted to eastern standard time. The data on screen shuffles about and grows more and more uniform.

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you can see a pattern slowly begins to emerge. Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mirror each other while Tuesdays and Thursdays are similar.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: What a weird pattern... What does it means?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: It means there is structure in his life, something he can’t change. Something he’s working around.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: So he’s on a schedule.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Exactly.  58. They mull over the possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s a pilot and that’s his flight schedule.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: No, I’ve already checked with the FAA, no flight crews’ schedule parallel this pattern.

dialogues.speaker: DT. WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: But it’s gotta be some kind of transportation schedule, right?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: No, not necessarily... The anthrax killer struck by mail. He killed people in three different states without ever leaving his lab.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: So what is it?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: (pause) It kinda looks like a college kid’s schedule.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: That's what I was thinking. DT. GOEMMANS . Wait a second? Are you sayin’ Kira might be a freakin’ Coed?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Well, I think our guy is either a student or someone who’s affiliated with a local college or university. Look at what we know about him. He’s very tech savvy. That inherently trends towards a younger, educated perp. Probably Gen Y, or the millennium generation. He’s brash and idealistic; again indicators of a younger, more likely than not, male perp. Now couple these traits with the fact that the e-mail sent to the Times came from a Wi-Fi network that was hacked near Fordham .University... and I think a rough sketch of our perp starts to come into focus. He's probably a’ young male, in his mid twenties. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: L, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He might be a grad student or a TA. Probably Caucasian. Quiet. Known for being somewhat reserved. But there is something in his past that drives him. There’s something damaged about him. That’s the guy we are looking for. They take it all in, especially Capt. Murray.

dialogues.speaker: DT. GOEMMANS
dialogues.text: Great... white guy, mid twenties, good with computers and a little crazy. In New York, that’s like two million people.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a start. Check in with all the local colleges, Fordham, NYU, Columbia, Pace... Talk to the mental health administrators. See if there’s anyone they think is suspicious. (pause) I know it’s like searching for a needle in a haystack. But let’s try and turn up the heat on this guy. The men nod in agreement as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. a debate erupts amongst some STUDENTS at lunch. Among them is Luke and Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I wanna know how Kira’s doing it.

dialogues.speaker: MALE STUDENT
dialogues.text: Who cares, as long as he keeps up the good work. A GIRL STUDENT shoots him a look. MALE STUDENT (CONT’D) What? No one wants to admit it but they’re glad these guys are dying.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL STUDENT
dialogues.text: Hey, this isn’t a video game. You don’t die and respawn three seconds later.  The girls 60.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, nobody has the right to do what he’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (interjects) I think it’s for the greater good.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: How can you say that?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: People die all the time, for no good reason. And it sucks. (beat ) At least these people are dying for something.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL STUDENT
dialogues.text: Luke, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It’s the Coventry Dilemma all over again.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL STUDENT
dialogues.text: What’s the Coventry Dilemma?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It’s kind of a long story... all give him a look. LUKE (CONT’D) Okay... well, during World War Two the British cracked the German “Enigma” cypher. It was a secret code the Nazis used. The Brits realized that the town of Coventry was going to get bombed. Now, their first instinct was to evacuate the town but then they realized they couldn’t do that. They had to let the Nazis bomb Coventry, otherwise the enemy would know they had broken the code. In the end thousands of people died. Their lives were sacrificed to save countless others... And that’s what we have here now, on a much smaller scale.
