If you make an example out of say, a hundred criminals, you could save countless innocent lives and spare thousands of families from all kinds of hardship. Is it fair? Is it right? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s hard to say. But like Churchill said, “it's all for the greater good.” The girls look on, taken aback. Luke has shut them up in fell swoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'm gettin’ ready for work.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY

dialogues.text: No. I actually got a surprise for you. Capt. Murray hands him a letter. CAPT. MURRAY (CONT’D) It’s from the mayor himself, completely hand written. How many law school applicants have that? (MORE )

dialogues.text: CAPT. MURRAY (CONT’D) (proudly pointing) I love this line, “Luke's heroism on the subway speaks volumes, for his future is far brighter than most, yet he was willing to risk it all to do what was right.”

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta let it go, Luke.  63.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Like you did, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: Hey, watch your mouth.

dialogues.text: Now you know how it feels! 101. It’s up and Emotion overwhelms him. He’s really going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No! SIRENS BLARE. Brett shoots a look out the window -- sees COPS arriving, when -- -- Sophia breaks free and makes a run for it. down as Brett takes aim. Time slows  102. INT. L’S HOTEL ROOM Everyone looks on with bated breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke charges towards Sophia, when...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No, don’t -- ! ++. BAM -- BRETT FIRES -- Luke steps in front of the shot shielding Sophia. THUMP -- the sound of flesh tearing fil the room as he crumbles to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: INT. L’'S HOTEL ROOM They all stand there horrified as...

dialogues.speaker: INT, LIBRARY
dialogues.text: «+. Sophia kneels down next to Luke as a pool of blood sp onto the marble floor.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh my God... He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Don’t be... He grabs hold of her hand and touches the Claddagh ring h gave her. She looks at it as she wells up with emotion. “I love you” crosses his face but he doesn’t have the strength to say it as he loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Somebody help, please! God please, somebody help us!!! Luke! Lukel!! Brett takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you shoot him!  103. The COPS storm in -- guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Put the weapon down! Brett sizes up the cops. before bringing the gun to his h

dialogues.speaker: COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! BAM! -- his knees buckle as a round casing bounces off th floor and his limp body collapses from a self inflicted g shot. INT. L’S HOTEL ROOM Everyone watches in horror as the cops rush to Luke, Soph and Brett. Capt. Murray explodes, he grabs L and JACKS him up agains the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: You're gonna pay for this L. I swear to God! The other detectives struggle to restrain Capt. Murray as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +++ blood spews out from Luke’s belly. MEDICS lift him on a gurney and into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia solemnly sits as Capt. Murray hurriedly approaches

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It’s touch and go. Tears stream down her face as Capt. Murray consoles her, trying to be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heart monitor BEEPS as Luke lies still... His eyes slow open. It takes him a moment to shake the cobwebs as... +.» Capt. Murray, Sarah and Sophia slowly. get up from th seats.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh, thank god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, bandaged up, exits with Capt. Murray.

dialogues.speaker: CAPT. MURRAY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go get the car. Hang tight. Capt. Murray takes off as Luke fishes through a bag of personal items. He finds his sidekick and turns it on. He looks at it curiously. He’s got a video message but th strange thing is it’s from himself.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: There's something you need to know... You're Kira. And I’m here to tell you what happened. Luke is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: After they removed the cameras you tried to destroy the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Death Note is engulfed in flames.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: But you realized it couldn't be destroyed. Luke is astonished when the flames recede and the Death N remains unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: You thought about throwing it away but you were afraid of who might find it and what they might do with it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: You were at a loss, you didn't know what to do... That's when I took over. Luke’s eyes narrow and harden again as he stands there in junk yard, clutching the Death Note. (note: everything Lu does from here on is under the auspicious of the book).

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: We realized that a cloud of suspicion still hung over you. And there were loose ends that still needed to be tied up. Gurtsky was still out there. He opens the Death Note and draws his pen.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: But we couldn't just kill him because that would only draw more suspicion... Luke writes in the book one last time.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: ++. It would've been a mistake. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia cradles Luke as he lies there bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: And a mistake can cost someone their life... Brett takes in the scene -- aghast at what he’s done.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: +... Brett’s mistake was talking to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke writes in the Death Note. SUPER: the TEXT of the DEATH NOTE ENTRY over the AFTERMAT the SHOOTING as Luke reveals how he orchestrated it all:  106.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Brett Gurtsky, suicide. He arranges to meet with his brother’s killer by taking his girlfriend hostage on June 5th 2008.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: He forces the girlfriend to call him and then contacts the investigative team...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: +.. and tries to make the killer confess as they watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia breaks free from Brett.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He tries to stop the hostage when she runs away and purposely shoots low center mass. BRETT lowers his aim and SQUEEZES OFF a ROUND.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: We knew you would do the heroic thing. Luke steps in front of the shot, shielding Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: We just had to make sure it wasn’t a lethal hit. Luke crumbles to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: A shot to the stomach would be painful, but it wouldn’t kill you.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands there in shock.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: Then we took care of Brett. INT. LIBRARY —- (FLASHBACK) Brett is stunned by what he has done. He brings the gun t his head.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In a moment of madness, Brett kills himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke has to sit down. It’s as if he got kicked in the gut

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: We knew that if they saw you get shot there’s no way they'd continue to suspect you. INT. L’S HOTEL ROOM (FLASHBACK) Capt. Murray, L and the investigative team watch in horro Luke lies on the floor, blood spewing.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: But for you to really sell it, you needed to not know what was going on. That's why it was so perfect to give up the book and lose your memory of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks on, agape.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: But we have unfinished work to do. We've hidden the book in an abandoned cemetery. cur TO:  108.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FLASHBACK)
dialogues.text: He pours cement onto the Death Note, encasing it within a headstone mold.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: Because we realized if we were to bury it in the ground or hide it in the house someone could find it. Luke removes the headstone from the mold.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: But there are social and moral reasons why a headstone would go untouched. Luke carries the headstone into an abandoned cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (FROM VIDEO MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: And I'm here to show you where it is... The video message begins to pan across St. Demetri’s Ceme when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. Luke SNAPS his sidekick shut and SLINGS it against th wall -- SHATTERING IT.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Oh my god... what have I done?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: Luke stands there breathing heavily when he feels the wei of a stare. He turns and sees L approaching him.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Hey, are you alright? Luke studies him. How long has he been watching?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (blankly) I’m sorry, do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: No... But I know you. L pulls out a bag of chips and begins to eat (it’s the sa brand Luke used in the potato chip sequence).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke solemnly lays flowers on his mother’s grave.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Someone once said that the highest proof of virtue is to possess boundless power without abusing it... but they never had a Death Note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke pensively walks along.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every day I pass by the cemetery. He scans the grounds of the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't know which headstone it's in but the truth is -- I don't want to know. I just want to know it's there, where no one can get to it. INT. LUKE’S ROOM - DAY Luke sits in his chair, deep in thought, looking at some news clipping.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I spent a lot of time alone afterwards thinking about what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sits in a pew.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn’t make sense of it all. Because the truth is, I let it happen. Luke breaks down and lowers his head.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke eyes his father and his team through a window.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I thought about turning myself in and confessing... Luke begins to cross the street, moving towards his fathe office. -

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ++. but how could I explain what happened without the book. Luke stops, thinks better of it and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I realized I could never tell anyone what happened, but not because of what they would do to me. No, the truth is the book is just too dangerous. I knew it then and I know it now. The world shouldn’t know it exists. Nothing good can come from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke brings a bunch of books to a CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But I knew I still owed the house for the lives that had been taken. Maybe I could never repay that debt. But I had to try. I decided I was gonna spend the rest of my life fighting the good fight, trying to help those that were unjustly convicted. Maybe by saving them I could undo some of the harm I did.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: You a L1?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Don’t let them rattle you. That’s what the first year of law school is all about.  111.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke walks along with Sophia, law books in tow.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I’m glad you finally came to your senses.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Luke takes her hand in his as they walk past the cemetery He can’t help but shoot one last look back at the headsto as we... «+.» SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK
